Articles.Content:
Hello guys, my name is Ariel and I'm from Brasil. I've been playing KSP for two months and lurking in the forums for one week, so I decided to create a account to share some ideas and say thanks to you that inspired me and helped me a lot with my progress in the game.

See you in KSC.

Peace

I hope by KSC you mean the Kennedy Space Center. I'd freaking go there all the time.

Did I already say where the cookies were? We'll just say that I did and party now.
Welcome aboard! I bet you'll have fun here!

Thanks guys.

Peace

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-06T22:20:57Z" title="08/06/2015 10:20  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 6, 2015</time> by Zais**

I read KSC as Kerbal Space Center and thought you had located it in real life. Maybe on this street? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

![1NgZ6DW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1NgZ6DW.jpg)

Nope. Just the normal KSC that we all know.

Peace.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-08T02:53:01Z" title="08/08/2015 02:53  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 8, 2015</time> by Zais**
  
Typos

Welcome, Zais! I have a Brazilian Ph.D student staying at my house now. Apparently the Chinese word for "Grape" sounds like the Portuguese word for... never mind.

Happy international confusion!

> 
> Welcome, Zais! I have a Brazilian Ph.D student staying at my house now. Apparently the Chinese word for "Grape" sounds like the Portuguese word for... never mind.
> Happy international confusion!

Lol I spoke Chinese all my life, also know a bit of Portuguese from international relations but I don't confuse the two. They are similar, but not identical enough to cause Freudian slips.

> 
> Lol I spoke Chinese all my life, also know a bit of Portuguese from international relations but I don't confuse the two. They are similar, but not identical enough to cause Freudian slips.

That's funny. The other student at my house is chinese. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

It wasn't a Freudian slip. I was learning the words for food at the dinner table in Chinese, and suddenly the Brazilian started cracking up.

Lol don't worry about it. Sometimes I understand things in a different way. Like putting less boosters instead of moar ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
